qas.question: How do modern hunters and gathers differ from early ones?

context: Hunting-gathering was the common human mode of subsistence throughout <b4_0>the Paleolithic<b4_0/>, but the observation of current-day hunters and gatherers does not necessarily reflect <a3_0><b6_0>Paleolithic societies<b6_0/><a3_0/>; the <b8_0>hunter-gatherer<b8_0/> cultures examined today have had much <a0_0>contact with <b7_0>modern civilization<b7_0/><a0_0/> and do not represent <b5_0>"<a1_0>pristine<a1_0/>" conditions found <a2_0>in uncontacted peoples<b5_0/><a2_0/>.
